citation.article-title: Cryobacterium mesophilum sp. nov., a novel mesophilic bacterium.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Emended description of the genus Cryobacterium Suzuki et al. 1997
Cryobacterium [Cry.o.bac.te′ri.um. Gr. n. kryos cold; Gr. n. bakterion a small rod; N.L. neut. n. Cryobacterium a cold (preferring) rod].
Cells are motile or non-motile, pleomorphic rods (0.3–0.8×1.0–3.6 μm).
Gram-positive (may be Gram-variable in old cultures).
DNase and nitrate reduction are variable; catalase-positive.
Negative for gelatin hydrolysis and the assimilation of hippurate, but variable for casein hydrolysis.
The DNA G+C content ranges from 65 to 70 mol%.
Rhamnose and fucose or glucose and ribose are the characteristic cell-wall sugars.
The major fatty acid is anteiso-C15 : 0.
The major menaquinones are MK-10, MK-11 and MK-12.
The polar lipids are diphosphatidylglycerol, phosphatidylglycerol and unidentified glycolipids.
The type species is Cryobacterium psychrophilum.
